result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph E. Koski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph E. Koski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph E. Koski was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 30 dtp or 24 days KCJ or 12 days work crew.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph E. Koski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: $616 due in 30 days or 24 days KCJ or 12 days work crew.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Caviale.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  Deft fined $50 plus costs.  30 DTP.  In default, 12 days work crew or 24 days KCJ
confirming email sent to attys - plea hrg 3/3/15 @ 1:15pm
Email received from defense counsel - case is resolved; plea hrg 3/3/15 @ 1:15pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Caviale.  Case not resolved.  Leave on for trial for 3/2/15 @ 9am.  Defense counsel has until 2/25/15 by 5pm to notify the court if the case is settled; otherwise, no plea bargaining after that date.  If the case does resolve, the clerk will give the parties a different time for the plea hrg.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Caviale.  Complaining witness present; briefly questioned by the Court and Atty Caviale.  Arguments heard on deft's motion to lift the no contact order.  Court lifts the no contact order between the deft and the complaining witness.  Court re-iterates - no alcohol & no drugs.
to Modify Bond - filed by deft
Scheduling Order

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. John Caviale. Clerk LE.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 2-11-15 @ 9:10am. Jury selection on 3-2-15 @ 9:00am.  Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
